guide.introduction:
I wanted to see if I could build a display that didn't require learning how to program PICs or Arduinos. There are pros and cons to this project, like any other.

PROs:

. Easy to build

. Reasonable image (considering it's 8x8)

. Requires only a parallel port to drive it

. Easy to scale up to more than one display if one so desires.

CONs:

. Image quality relies on the computer's dedication to the application driving the parallel port.

lines.text: Since we need 9 pins to drive the display (8 led columns, plus 1 to increment the row) We'll use the usual data lines (Pins 2-9) and the Strobe line (pin 1)

lines.text: We'll be using the LPT port to do pulse width modulation to control the LED brightness.

guide.summary: Cheap and easy 8x8 LED Matrix, controlled by the parallel port. No microprocessors necessary, just an LED matrix, a 4017 decade counter, some transistors and a bunch of resistors.
guide.title: Easy LPT LED Matrix Display
